results.name: Shallow diagonal sums of A211226.
comment: The even-indexed terms a(2*n) count the compositions of n+2 into odd parts while the odd-indexed terms a(2*n+3) count the total number of parts in the compositions of n+2 into odd parts.
formula: Let f(n) := (floor(n/2))! and define c(n,k) = f(n)/(f(k)*f(n-k)) = A211226(n,k). Then a(n) = sum {k = 0..floor(n/2)} c(n-k,k).
example: The compositions of 5 into odd parts are 1+1+1+1+1, 1+1+3, 1+3+1, 3+1+1 and 5. Hence a(6) = 5 and a(9) = 15.
